intro: Schoberia pallasiana, commonly known as the Pallas's bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan, Russia, and Mongolia. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Schoberia pallasiana is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands at high elevations.
